name: DebugRenderingContext
comment:
A debug implementation of the lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.RenderingContext.

The lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.DebugRenderingContext wraps a lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.RenderingContext context and passes along all call to it. After the call to the context is checked for errors. If an error is encountered it is written to the lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.DebugRenderingContext.onError stream.

A lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.DebugRenderingContext should only be used during development as it creates an additional overhead to each call.

canvas.name: canvas
canvas.comment: Reference to the canvas element to which this context belongs.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
Overload of lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.DebugRenderingContext.noSuchMethod.

Used to forward calls to the underlying lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.RenderingContext.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.DebugRenderingContext.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.DebugRenderingContext.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.DebugRenderingContext.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.DebugRenderingContext.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.DebugRenderingContext.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.DebugRenderingContext.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.DebugRenderingContext.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.

bufferByteData.name: bufferByteData
bufferByteData.comment:
Buffers the specified data.

This specific method is provided for WebGL API compatibility reasons, but it is highly recommended that you use lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.DebugRenderingContext.bufferDataTyped or lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.DebugRenderingContext.bufferByteData depending on your purposes.

bufferData.comment:

texImage2D.name: texImage2D
texImage2D.comment:
Updates the currently bound texture to data.

This specific method is provided for WebGL API compatibility reasons, but it is highly recommended that you use lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.DebugRenderingContext.texImage2DUntyped or lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.DebugRenderingContext.texImage2DTyped (or for more specificity, the more specialized lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.DebugRenderingContext.texImage2DImageData, lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.DebugRenderingContext.texImage2DCanvas, lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.DebugRenderingContext.texImage2DVideo).

texImage2DUntyped.name: texImage2DUntyped
texImage2DUntyped.comment:
Sets the currently bound texture to lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.DebugRenderingContext.texImage2DUntyped.data.

lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.DebugRenderingContext.texImage2DUntyped.data can be either an lithium_ion/dart-dom-html.ImageElement, a lithium_ion/dart-dom-html.CanvasElement, a lithium_ion/dart-dom-html.VideoElement, or an lithium_ion/dart-dom-html.ImageData object.

To use texImage2d with a TypedData object, use texImage2dTyped.

texSubImage2DUntyped.name: texSubImage2DUntyped
texSubImage2DUntyped.comment:
Updates a sub-rectangle of the currently bound texture to lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.DebugRenderingContext.texSubImage2DUntyped.data.

lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.DebugRenderingContext.texSubImage2DUntyped.data can be either an lithium_ion/dart-dom-html.ImageElement, a lithium_ion/dart-dom-html.CanvasElement, a lithium_ion/dart-dom-html.VideoElement, or an lithium_ion/dart-dom-html.ImageData object.

To use texSubImage2d with a TypedData object, use texSubImage2dTyped.

texSubImage2DTyped.name: texSubImage2DTyped
texSubImage2DTyped.comment: Updates a sub-rectangle of the currently bound texture to lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.DebugRenderingContext.texSubImage2DTyped.data.
